channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nikki Haley says she'll vote for Trump
item.description: The former South Carolina governor's remarks were her first on the matter since she dropped out of the presidential race. But she stopped short of formally endorsing her former rival.
item.content:encoded:
The former South Carolina governor's remarks were her first on the matter since she dropped out of the presidential race. But she stopped short of formally endorsing her former rival.

(Image credit: Emil Lippe)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Hershey's lawsuit argues the company uses 'deceptive' packaging in Reese's products
item.description: Four plaintiffs in Florida say Hershey falsely represented several Reese's Peanut Butter products by showing "explicit carved-out artistic designs" on the wrappers being sold.
item.content:encoded: Four plaintiffs in Florida say Hershey falsely represented several Reese's Peanut Butter products by showing "explicit carved-out artistic designs" on the wrappers being sold.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: After years in decline, U.S. drowning deaths are rising again
item.description: For the first time in decades, the number of drowning deaths in the United States is on the rise. Researchers say part of the reason for the spike is the pandemic when many pools were closed.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time in decades, the number of drowning deaths in the United States is on the rise. Researchers say part of the reason for the spike is the pandemic when many pools were closed.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: A concentrated dose of history: The class of 2024 looks back
item.description:
Everyone says you live through history, but "I don't think anyone prepared us for this much history," say the students in the Class of 2024.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Everyone says you live through history, but "I don't think anyone prepared us for this much history," say the students in the Class of 2024.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

item.title: A Michigan farmworker is diagnosed with bird flu in 2nd U.S. case tied to dairy cows
item.description: The Michigan dairy worker had mild eye symptoms from the infection and has recovered, health officials said. The worker had been in contact with cows presumed to be infected.
item.content:encoded: The Michigan dairy worker had mild eye symptoms from the infection and has recovered, health officials said. The worker had been in contact with cows presumed to be infected.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Taiwan's New Government, With an Eye Towards China
item.description: A new president in Taiwan was inaugurated this week. Lai Ching-te will now lead a Taiwan that is divided politically on many issues, including on how to confront China. We'll hear from our correspondent in Taipei and from some young Taiwanese preparing for mandatory military service.
item.content:encoded: A new president in Taiwan was inaugurated this week. Lai Ching-te will now lead a Taiwan that is divided politically on many issues, including on how to confront China. We'll hear from our correspondent in Taipei and from some young Taiwanese preparing for mandatory military service.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Mangroves protect communities from storms. Half are at risk of collapse, report finds
item.description: Mangroves are unique coastal ecosystems protecting humans and wildlife. Rising sea levels and storms pose an increasing threat to their survival.
item.content:encoded:
Mangroves are unique coastal ecosystems protecting humans and wildlife. Rising sea levels and storms pose an increasing threat to their survival.

(Image credit: Sia Kambou)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: Lack of staffing led to 'deeply concerning' conditions at federal prison in Oregon
item.description: The shortage among the biggest obstacles facing the federal prison system and contribute to challenges at FCI Sheridan and other facilities, the Justice Department's inspector general says.
item.content:encoded: The shortage among the biggest obstacles facing the federal prison system and contribute to challenges at FCI Sheridan and other facilities, the Justice Department's inspector general says.
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: The MacArthur Foundation wants bold solutions to big problems — the prize is $100M
item.description: The MacArthur Foundation is looking for ideas that would solve one of the biggest global challenges. The winning proposal will receive $100 million.
item.content:encoded:
The MacArthur Foundation is looking for ideas that would solve one of the biggest global challenges. The winning proposal will receive $100 million.

(Image credit: Ryan Donnell)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Billions from Russia's frozen assets will go to help Ukraine's military, the EU says
item.description: Under the plan, the European Union will send as much as $3.25 billion in profits from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine to help finance its military and reconstruction efforts.
item.content:encoded:
Under the plan, the European Union will send as much as $3.25 billion in profits from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine to help finance its military and reconstruction efforts.

(Image credit: Alexander Nemenov)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
